title: SQL ServerSYSDATETIME()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerSYSDATETIME()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the date and time of the SQL Server:
SELECT SYSDATETIME() AS SysDateTime;

Definition and Usage
The SYSDATETIME() function returns the date and time of the computer where the SQL Server is running.
Syntax
SYSDATETIME()
Technical Details
Return type:
datetime2(7)
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse

❯
★
+1

quiz.question: What is function returns the date and time of the computer where the SQL Server?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of function returns the date and time of the computer where the SQL Server is 'running'.
